MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning?
Choices: a: Alan Turing | b: Arthur Samuel | c: Donald Hebb | d: Walter Pitts

MCQ: In which year was the term machine learning coined?
What was the name of the experimental 'learning machine' developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a: Cybertron | b: Neuralyst | c: TechnoBrain | d: DataMinder

MCQ: Who provided a formal definition of the algorithms studied in the machine learning field?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Walter Pitts | c: Tom M. Mitchell | d: Warren McCulloch

MCQ: What are the two objectives of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To create data models and to predict future outcomes | b: To analyze human cognitive processes and to develop neural networks | c: To classify data based on models and to make predictions for future outcomes | d: To study the history of machine learning and to experiment with learning machines
